result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Larry D Simmons
Current: Oneida County Jail, 2000 East Winnebago St, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 08-24-2022)
Prior: Dane County Jail, Madison, WI
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Atty Michael Covey
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 17

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE advises he wants to waive his right to an attorney for the prelim today. Court completes colloquy with DE regarding waiver of attorney.   The Court held a colloquy with the defendant prior to approving his waiver of counsel to ensure he was waiving his rights competently, deliberately, and voluntarily.  The court apprised the defendant of his right to counsel, of the advantages of counsel, and of the difficulties and disadvantages of self-representation.  The Court also apprised the defendant of the nature and elements of the charges and the range of possible penalties upon entry of a guilty plea.  Based on this colloquy, the Court approved the defendants waiver of counsel for the preliminary hearing only. 

State moves to find counts 1-4 transactionally related and gives argument. DE objects. Court makes findings and finds counts 1 and 4 transactionally related. Court dismisses counts 2 and 3, without objections from the State. Witness D.G. is duly sworn and testified. State with direct exam. Venue established. Cross exam by the DE. Witness is excused. Witness J.W. is duly sworn and testifies. Direct by the State. Venue established. DE identified. Cross by DE. State moves for bind over, reserves argument. DE does not object to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds over to Branch 17.

The Court held a colloquy with the defendant prior to approving his waiver of counsel to ensure he was waiving his rights competently, deliberately, and voluntarily.  The court apprised the defendant of his right to counsel, of the advantages of counsel, and of the difficulties and disadvantages of self-representation.  The Court also apprised the defendant of the nature and elements of the charges and the range of possible penalties upon entry of a guilty plea.  Based on this colloquy, the Court approved the defendants waiver of counsel.- FOR PRELIMINARY HEARING ONLY
SPD appointment Status

02:21 PM Defendant in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defn eligible for SPD; awaiting appt.  Court finds good cause to set matter over for Prelim Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bond form returned unsigned. Def refused.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

*** CORRECTED *** 
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KRC, ASRB, Ray C, any child of KRC, or any other family member of KRC. 
- Defendant shall not be at or around any residence of KRC. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

03:07 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
